headline: QUIZ: 2003 pop culture
description: It has been 15 years since New York City hosted the Grammy Awards, and a lot has certainly changed since then. Here’s a quick flashback to test your knowledge of what music, pop culture, and the world was like in 2003.
question: Who was the president?
result: 0-5 It seems you may have been living under a rock in 2003.

question: This artist was nominated for Best New Artist, Song of the Year, Album of the Year, Best Female Pop Vocal Performance, and Best Pop Vocal Album! Phew, that was a lot!
result: 6-10 You were paying attention in 2003. That's good.

question: Which team won the NBA Championship in 2003?
result: 11-15 The early 2000s were clearly influential for you. Cheers!

question: Which artist won best rap album of the year?
What show(s) were we tuning in to watch?
Usher won Best Male R&B vocal performance. Fill in the missing word in this lyric to his song “U Don’t Have to Call”: “Gonna boogie tonight ‘cause I’m honestly too____ of a guy”
Which of these films was the summer blockbuster?
b: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King

question: Who was the mayor of NYC in 2003?
Bruce Springsteen’s “The Rising” won best rock song of the year. Can you finish the lyrics to this line?: “A dream of life comes to me…”
answer: Like a catfish dancin’ on the end of the line
a: And then I feel your blood mix with mine
b: Like a catfish dancin’ on the end of the line
c: Come on up, lay your hands in mine

question: This girl group won a Grammy in 2003.
Which popular music service made its debut in 2003?
How much did a 30-day metro card cost in 2003?
Craig David won Best Vocal Performance for his song “7 Days.” According to the song, what did his Tuesday date night entail?
answer: He took the girl out for drinks
a: He took a girl out dancing
b: He and the girl stayed in
c: He took the girl out for drinks
d: He and the girl broke up

question: What was the primary social media platform in 2003?
Which of these events did not happen in New York City 2003?
answer: A naked man scaled the Empire State Building as a form of protest
c: Smoking was banned in indoor spaces
d: A naked man scaled the Empire State Building as a form of protest
blurb: The blackout DID happen. Less than two years after the September 11th attacks, New Yorkers initially feared terrorism. Their concerns were assuaged when Mayor Michael Bloomberg announced that the blackout was actually caused by a massive power outage sweeping across the Northeast.
